column1: Victoria Falls/Folosi is a town in the province of Matabeleland North
column2: Zimbabwe. It lies on the southern bank of the Zambezi River at the western end of Victoria Falls themselves. According to the 2012 Population Census
column3: the town had a population of 33

column1: The settlement began in 1901 when the possibility of using the waterfall for hydro-electric power was explored
column2: and expanded when the railway from Bulawayo reached the town shortly before the Victoria Falls Bridge was opened in April 1905
column3: connecting Southern Rhodesia (later Rhodesia; now Zimbabwe) to Northern Rhodesia (later Zambia). It became the principal tourism centre for the Falls
column4: experiencing economic booms from the 1930s to the 1960s and in the 1980s and early 1990s.

column1: The town is located northwest of its province
column2: in front of the borders with Zambia
column3: separated from it by the Zambezi River and the binational Victoria Falls. It lies few km from the Zambian city of Livingstone
column4: and is surrounded by the Zambezi
column5: Mosi-oa-Tunya and Victoria Falls national parks.

column2: both to the south-east. Victoria Falls Airport is located 18 km south of the town and has international services to Johannesburg and Namibia.
